subject: Re: [junit] TestNG 4 and Data Providers
msgSnippet: ... Is this thing on? NOT ALL ASSERTIONS ARE assertEquals()! If I just get AssertionFailedError at line 23 because assertNotNull() failed, I have /no idea/
messageBody:
Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> I exchanged a few emails with JB about that, and my take on "data names" is
> basically: I don't see the need.
>
> If a test method being fed by a data provider fails, it will clearly say
> something like "Expected 42 but got 41". From that point, it's pretty easy
> to trace which data from the data set caused this error and act on it.

Is this thing on?

NOT ALL ASSERTIONS ARE assertEquals()!

If I just get AssertionFailedError at line 23 because assertNotNull()
failed, I have /no idea/ which row of test data caused that failure.

That said, test names is the way I usually solve this problem. I admit
there are other solutions, but if you don't let me give you a test name,
then you /force/ me to use a failure message (to display, for example,
enough input data to distinguish one test from another) when I otherwise
wouldn't have needed one. More work than necessary.

Take care.

(PS: You know I love you. I was just kidding.)
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
2005 Gordon Pask Award Winner for contribution to Agile practice
Author, JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
